analysis: The documents establish presidential commissions, committees, or boards to address specific issues. These issues range from aviation security and terrorism to federal service fundraising, rural economic development, labor disputes, cost reduction in government, radiation policy, CIA activities, river basin management, and Indian reservation economies. The commissions are typically composed of members appointed by the President, including government officials and private citizens. They are tasked with studying the issues, evaluating policies, and making recommendations to the President. The documents also outline administrative details such as compensation, staffing, and funding.
title: Presidential Advisory Groups on Policy & Governance
